solution_line_template: If Trevor spends ${trevor_more_than_reed} more than Reed every year to buy toys, Reed spends ${trevor_spend}-${trevor_more_than_reed} = ${reed_spend}.
Since Reed uses ${reed_spend} every year to buy toys, his friend Quinn uses {reed_spend}/{reed_times_quinn} = $<<{reed_spend}/{reed_times_quinn}={quinn_spend}>>{quinn_spend} every year to buy toys.

The total amount of money the three spend in a year together to buy toys is ${quinn_spend}+${reed_spend}+${trevor_spend} = $<<{quinn_spend}+{reed_spend}+{trevor_spend}={total_spend_per_year}>>{total_spend_per_year}.

The total amount of money the three will use to buy toys in {number_of_years} years is ${total_spend_per_year}*{number_of_years} = $<<{total_spend_per_year}*{number_of_years}={total_spend_four_years}>>{total_spend_four_years}.
